definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")

pinyin: Wen1 bu4 er3 deng1 Wang3 qiu2 Gong1 kai1 sai4
shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

sentences.english: The open of prison affairs is called the sunlight project in our country's prison system.
sentences.chinese: 狱务公开被誉为我国监狱系统的阳光工程。

sentences.english: This competition is open to two categories: Open Category and Secondary Category.
sentences.chinese: 是次比赛分公开及中学组两组。

sentences.english: Chapter Two, development process of publicizing general village affairs.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，村务公开的发展历程。

sentences.english: He was very open about his inspiration and his plans for his career.
sentences.chinese: 对于他的梦想和职业生涯计划，韩庚是很公开的。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a construction method for a door opening of an old structural underground wall.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种老结构地下墙开门洞施工方法。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a device and a method for real-time stream file storage.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种实时流文件存储装置及其方法。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a method for detoxicating rapeseed cakes or rapeseed dregs.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种菜籽饼或菜籽粕的脱毒方法。

sentences.english: An open war between Sweden and Russia broke out in 1554.
sentences.chinese: 1554年，瑞典同露西亚公开爆发战争。

sentences.english: Thus, embodiments of a virtual local memory for a graphics processor are disclosed.
sentences.chinese: 这样，公开了图形处理器的虚拟本地存储器的实施例。

sentences.english: Yang Yun, her son, in his childhood, liked reading his grandfather's unopened manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 其外孙杨恽从小爱读外公这部尚未公开的书稿。

sentences.english: The present invention discloses one kind of electric roaster capable of controlling the oil content of cooked food.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种可控制烹饪食物油脂的电烤炉。

sentences.english: Contemplated share offerings, both initial public offerings and straightforward share issuances , are being put back on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 首次公开募股等各种预期中的股票发行也已经搁置。

sentences.english: Open and attentive followthrough is necessary to resolve issues.
sentences.chinese: 公开和专心的追随对解决问题是必须的。

sentences.english: I heard that the appeal was heard in private.
sentences.chinese: 我听说这件上诉案没有公开审理。

sentences.english: Disclosed is an electrolytic cell for removal of material from a solution.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种从溶液去除物质的电解池。

sentences.english: Some religious leaders have also spoken out against fourth sexuality.
sentences.chinese: 一些宗教领袖也公开表示反对第四性。

definition: to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
to show one's face/to appear (in public)
to reveal/to publish/to make public/to announce
government/official (approved or issued by an authority)
to declare to be untrue/to deny
